name: client/components/Advertisement.js
Advertisement
description:
This is the Advertisement class that extends the Component class. This class is used to generate the ad services
sponsored by Google Ads and required for the PeterBook to be profitable.

name: constructor
description:
This constructor is inherited from the Component Super Class, and passes in a props object which
is a component that can be customized

params.name: props
params.description: A react component that can be customized, in this case the google ad.

name: render
description:
The render function invokes a specified element everytime and returns that element. In this case,
the function first checks if it can open the customized component (ad) , if it can open the
component (ad) then it proceed to invoke the google ad element.

unknown.tagValue: {*} - returns the invoked google ad element.

return.description: returns the invoked google ad element.

name: client/components/App.js
App
description: This App class is the main app JavaScript component.

name: constructor
description:
This constructor invokes the constructor from the super class Component. It's used to initialize the
login page by initializing the email and password fields to default empty.

params.name: props
params.description: react component that can be modified.

name: state
description:
The member variables of the page's state include a booolean to check if it's the login page, a string
field for the email, and a string field for the password.

name: handleLoginCrudSwap
description:
The method handleLoginCrudSwap , uses the create, read, update, and delete mechanism
to handle the user's input email and input password.

name: handleCrudLoginSwap
description:
The method handleCrudLoginSwap , uses the create, read, update, and delete mechanism to restore the
the login back to it's original state once a user has finished loggin in.

name: render
description:
The render method invokes the PeterBook components that handle login page interactions with email,
password, and clicked items.

The render moethod invokes the formatted id, email, and password using a formatted table.
It also handles the event of a click.

name: client/components/PostPopup.js
initialState
description:
The public members incorporated to assist with signup functionality handling when a user uploads a picture or
video type file.

types: {message: string, open: boolean, dimmer: string, aspect: string, imageFile: null, videoFile: null}

name: Signup
description:
The PostPopup class is used to supplement functionality for handling when a user uploads a picture or
video type file.

name: constructor
description: The constructor passes a props object which is a react component that can be modified for use.

params.name: props
params.description: a react component that can be modified

name: state
description: The public members needed to update the state of the React component.

types: {message: string, open: boolean, dimmer: string, aspect: string, imageFile: null, videoFile: null}

name: handleSubmit
description: The handleSubmit fires when a user attemps to add picture/video file.

name: show
description: Show will emulate the dimmer effect which hides distractions to focus attention on particular content.

name: close
description: Close will stop emulating the dimmer effect and stop hiding distractions.

name: saveImage
description: The saveImage method is meant to save the image submitted by the user.

params.name: event
params.description: modifies the state of the react element

name: saveVideo
description: The saveVideo method is meant to save the video submitted by the user.

params.name: event
params.description: modifies the state of the react element

name: render
description:
The render method invokes the user's formmated social media application so that the user can post
image and video types on their social media template.

unknown.tagValue: {*} - invokes the formatted user's social media template ready for personalized posting.

return.description: invokes the formatted user's social media template ready for personalized posting.

initialState
description: The public members incorporated to complete the social network sign up functionality.

types: {username: string, password: string, repeat: string, email: string, message: Array, open: boolean, dimmer: string}

name: Signup
description: The Signup class is used to accomplish the sign up functionality for the social network web application.

name: constructor
description: The constructor passes a props object which is a react component that can be modified for use.

params.name: props
params.description: a react component that can be modified

name: state
description: The public members used to handle the sign up for the first time.

types: {username: string, password: string, repeat: string, email: string, message: Array, open: boolean, dimmer: string}

name: handleSubmit
description:
The handleSubmit fires when the sign up form is submitted. It ensures you use a proper username and
ensures password configuration.

name: show
description: Show will emulate the dimmer effect which hides distractions to focus attention on particular content.

name: close
description: Close will stop emulating the dimmer effect and stop hiding distractions.

name: redirPage
description:
The redirPage method handles the processed sign up form by authenticating a successful sign-up or re-directing
you to sign up again.

params.name: response
params.description: the response is parased to verify successful and failing sign-ups

name: render
description:
The render method invokes the formatted sign up page where the user can interact with the page to
accomplish the sign up procedure.

unknown.tagValue: {*} - invokes the formatted sign up page

return.description: invokes the formatted sign up page

name: client/components/Tmp.js
NameForm
description:
The tmp class is used to accomplish the functionality for the name form to assist users with submitting
their name form.

name: constructor
description: The constructor passes a props object which is a react component that can be modified for use.

params.name: props
params.description: a react component that can be modified

name: state
description:
The public members of this class are value and name which are of type string. They are used to fill
in the values of the name form.

name: handleChange
description: The handleChange method runs of every key stroke to update the React state.

params.name: event
params.description: modifies the state of the react element

name: handleSubmit
description:
The handleSubmit method configures the name form that is filled out by the user and is used when the
form is submitted.

params.name: event
params.description: modifies the state of the react element

name: render
description:
The render method invokes the formatted name form that utilizes the methods handleSubmit and handleChange
for the name form.

content:
{
  "name": "web",
  "version": "0.1.0",
  "private": true,
  "dependencies": {
    "axios": "^0.18.0",
    "babel-cli": "^6.26.0",
    "babel-loader": "^7.1.4",
    "babel-preset-es2015": "^6.24.1",
    "babel-preset-stage-0": "^6.24.1",
    "body-parser": "^1.18.2",
    "chai": "^4.1.2",
    "connect-ensure-login": "^0.1.1",
    "cookie-parser": "^1.4.3",
    "ejs": "^2.5.8",
    "enzyme": "^3.3.0",
    "enzyme-adapter-react-16": "^1.1.1",
    "esdoc-ecmascript-proposal-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-jsx-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-react-plugin": "^1.0.1",
    "express": "^4.16.3",
    "express-session": "^1.15.6",
    "extract-text-webpack-plugin": "^3.0.2",
    "faker": "^4.1.0",
    "html-webpack-plugin": "^3.2.0",
    "moment": "^2.22.1",
    "mongodb": "^3.0.7",
    "mongoose": "^5.0.15",
    "multer": "^1.3.0",
    "nodemailer": "^4.6.5",
    "nodemon": "^1.17.3",
    "package.json": "^2.0.1",
    "passport": "^0.4.0",
    "passport-local": "^1.0.0",
    "react": "^16.4.0",
    "react-bootstrap": "^0.32.1",
    "react-color": "^2.14.1",
    "react-dom": "^16.4.0",
    "react-google-ads": "^1.0.5",
    "react-modal": "^3.4.1",
    "react-responsive": "^4.1.0",
    "react-router-dom": "^4.2.2",
    "react-scripts": "^1.1.4",
    "semantic-ui-react": "^0.79.1",
    "style-loader": "^0.21.0",
    "sw-precache-webpack-plugin": "^0.11.5",
    "uuid": "^3.2.1",
    "webpack-manifest-plugin": "^2.0.3"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "test": "mocha ./test/*.js --compilers js:babel-core/register --recursive  --require ignore-styles",
    "dev:hot": "webpack-dev-server --hot --inline --progress --colors --watch --display-error-details --display-cached --content-base ./",
    "webpack": "webpack",
    "start": "npm run webpack --watch --hot && nodemon --exec babel-node -- bin/www",
    "lint": "esw --ignore-path .gitignore --color .",
    "lint-watch": "npm run lint -- --watch"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "babel-plugin-transform-es2015-arrow-functions": "^6.22.0",
    "bell-on-bundler-error-plugin": "^2.0.0",
    "css-loader": "^0.28.11",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "eslint": "^4.19.1",
    "eslint-plugin-react": "^7.7.0",
    "eslint-watch": "^3.1.4",
    "file-loader": "^1.1.11",
    "ignore-styles": "^5.0.1",
    "jsdom": "^11.11.0",
    "mocha": "^5.2.0",
    "react-addons-test-utils": "^15.6.2",
    "resolve-url-loader": "^2.3.0",
    "sinon": "^5.0.10",
    "url-loader": "^1.0.1",
    "webpack": "^4.6.0",
    "webpack-cli": "^2.0.15",
    "webpack-dev-middleware": "^2.0.6",
    "webpack-dev-server": "^3.1.3"
  }
}
